docsTags.name: virtualProp
docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: - Content is placed inside of the `.popover-content` element.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: arrow - The arrow that points to the reference element. Only applies on `ios` mode.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: content - The wrapper element for the default slot.

props.name: alignment
props.docs:
Describes how to align the popover content with the `reference` point.
Defaults to `"center"` for `ios` mode, and `"start"` for `md` mode.

props.name: animated
props.docs: If `true`, the popover will animate.

props.name: arrow
props.docs:
If `true`, the popover will display an arrow that points at the
`reference` when running in `ios` mode. Does not apply in `md` mode.

props.name: backdropDismiss
props.docs: If `true`, the popover will be dismissed when the backdrop is clicked.

props.name: component
props.docs:
The component to display inside of the popover.
You only need to use this if you are not using
a JavaScript framework. Otherwise, you can just
slot your component inside of `ion-popover`.

props.name: componentProps
props.docs:
The data to pass to the popover component.
You only need to use this if you are not using
a JavaScript framework. Otherwise, you can just
set the props directly on your component.

props.name: dismissOnSelect
props.docs:
If `true`, the popover will be automatically
dismissed when the content has been clicked.

props.name: enterAnimation
props.docs: Animation to use when the popover is presented.

props.name: event
props.docs: The event to pass to the popover animation.

props.name: htmlAttributes
props.docs: Additional attributes to pass to the popover.

props.name: isOpen
props.docs:
If `true`, the popover will open. If `false`, the popover will close.
Use this if you need finer grained control over presentation, otherwise
just use the popoverController or the `trigger` property.
Note: `isOpen` will not automatically be set back to `false` when
the popover dismisses. You will need to do that in your code.

props.name: keepContentsMounted
props.docs:
If `true`, the component passed into `ion-popover` will
automatically be mounted when the popover is created. The
component will remain mounted even when the popover is dismissed.
However, the component will be destroyed when the popover is
destroyed. This property is not reactive and should only be
used when initially creating a popover.

Note: This feature only applies to inline popovers in JavaScript
frameworks such as Angular, React, and Vue.

props.name: keyboardClose
props.docs: If `true`, the keyboard will be automatically dismissed when the overlay is presented.

props.name: leaveAnimation
props.docs: Animation to use when the popover is dismissed.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: reference
props.docs:
Describes what to position the popover relative to.
If `"trigger"`, the popover will be positioned relative
to the trigger button. If passing in an event, this is
determined via event.target.
If `"event"`, the popover will be positioned relative
to the x/y coordinates of the trigger action. If passing
in an event, this is determined via event.clientX and event.clientY.

props.name: showBackdrop
props.docs:
If `true`, a backdrop will be displayed behind the popover.
This property controls whether or not the backdrop
darkens the screen when the popover is presented.
It does not control whether or not the backdrop
is active or present in the DOM.

props.name: side
props.docs:
Describes which side of the `reference` point to position
the popover on. The `"start"` and `"end"` values are RTL-aware,
and the `"left"` and `"right"` values are not.

props.name: size
props.docs:
Describes how to calculate the popover width.
If `"cover"`, the popover width will match the width of the trigger.
If `"auto"`, the popover width will be determined by the content in
the popover.

props.name: translucent
props.docs:
If `true`, the popover will be translucent.
Only applies when the mode is `"ios"` and the device supports
[`backdrop-filter`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/backdrop-filter#Browser_compatibility).

props.name: trigger
props.docs:
An ID corresponding to the trigger element that
causes the popover to open. Use the `trigger-action`
property to customize the interaction that results in
the popover opening.

props.name: triggerAction
props.docs:
Describes what kind of interaction with the trigger that
should cause the popover to open. Does not apply when the `trigger`
property is `undefined`.
If `"click"`, the popover will be presented when the trigger is left clicked.
If `"hover"`, the popover will be presented when a pointer hovers over the trigger.
If `"context-menu"`, the popover will be presented when the trigger is right
clicked on desktop and long pressed on mobile. This will also prevent your
device's normal context menu from appearing.

methods.name: dismiss
methods.signature: dismiss(data?: any, role?: string, dismissParentPopover?: boolean) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Dismiss the popover overlay after it has been presented.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: data Any data to emit in the dismiss events.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: role The role of the element that is dismissing the popover. For example, 'cancel' or 'backdrop'.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text:
dismissParentPopover If `true`, dismissing this popover will also dismiss
a parent popover if this popover is nested. Defaults to `true`.

methods.name: onDidDismiss
methods.docs: Returns a promise that resolves when the popover did dismiss.

methods.name: onWillDismiss
methods.docs: Returns a promise that resolves when the popover will dismiss.

methods.name: present
methods.signature: present(event?: MouseEvent | TouchEvent | PointerEvent | CustomEvent) => Promise<void>
methods.docs:
Present the popover overlay after it has been created.
Developers can pass a mouse, touch, or pointer event
to position the popover relative to where that event
was dispatched.

events.docs:
Emitted after the popover has dismissed.
Shorthand for ionPopoverDidDismiss.

Emitted after the popover has presented.
Shorthand for ionPopoverWillDismiss.
Emitted after the popover has dismissed.
Emitted after the popover has presented.
Emitted before the popover has dismissed.
Emitted before the popover has presented.

Emitted before the popover has dismissed.
Shorthand for ionPopoverWillDismiss.

Emitted before the popover has presented.
Shorthand for ionPopoverWillPresent.

styles.name: --offset-x
styles.docs: The amount to move the popover by on the x-axis

styles.name: --offset-y
styles.docs: The amount to move the popover by on the y-axis

slots.docs: Content is placed inside of the `.popover-content` element.

parts.name: arrow
parts.docs: The arrow that points to the reference element. Only applies on `ios` mode.

parts.name: content
parts.docs: The wrapper element for the default slot.
